controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program include appropriate systems and controls to determine the beneficial owner of each customer, and carry out collection and verification either before providing a designated service or as soon as practicable after?
controls.detail-label: Describe your systems and controls for determining beneficial owners and the timing of collection/verification

controls.label: For customers who are individuals, does your program assume the customer and beneficial owner are the same person unless you have reasonable grounds to consider otherwise?

Does your program exempt the following customer types from beneficial ownership requirements: companies verified under simplified procedures (4.3.8), trusts verified under simplified procedures (4.4.8), Australian Government Entities, and foreign listed public companies (or their majority-owned subsidiaries) subject to disclosure requirements?
controls.detail-label: Describe how your program identifies and exempts these customer types from beneficial ownership collection

controls.label: Does your program collect each beneficial owner's full name?
Does your program collect either the beneficial owner's date of birth OR full residential address (or both)?

Does your program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls to determine whether any additional information (beyond the minimum required) should be collected and verified about any beneficial owner?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based approach to determining when additional beneficial owner information should be collected and verified

controls.label: Does your program require that verification of beneficial owner information be based on reliable and independent documentation, reliable and independent electronic data, or a combination of both?
controls.detail-label: Describe your verification approach and the sources you consider reliable and independent

controls.label: Does your program prevent use of the safe harbour procedure (4.12.7) when any beneficial owner is a foreign politically exposed person?
When using the safe harbour procedure for medium or lower risk beneficial owners, does your program collect the information required by 4.12.1 for each beneficial owner?

When using documentation-based safe harbour verification, does your program verify each beneficial owner's full name and either their full residential address or date of birth (or both) from: (a) an original or certified copy of a primary photographic ID, OR (b) both a primary non-photographic ID and a secondary ID?
controls.detail-label: Describe your documentation-based verification procedure and acceptable document types

controls.label: When using documentation-based safe harbour verification, does your program verify that documents have not expired (except Commonwealth passports expired within the preceding two years)?

When using electronic-based safe harbour verification, does your program verify each beneficial owner's full name and either their full residential address or date of birth (or both) using reliable and independent electronic data from at least two separate data sources?
controls.detail-label: Describe your electronic verification procedure and the data sources used

controls.label: Does your program include appropriate risk-based systems and controls to respond to any discrepancy that arises when verifying beneficial owner information, so that you can determine you are reasonably satisfied each beneficial owner is who the customer claims they are?
controls.detail-label: Describe your risk-based approach to responding to beneficial owner verification discrepancies

controls.label: When unable to ascertain a beneficial owner, does your program require you to identify and take reasonable measures to verify specified individuals (based on customer type and control thresholds)?
controls.detail-label: Describe your fallback procedure when beneficial owners cannot be determined

controls.label: For companies (not verified under simplified procedures) or partnerships where the beneficial owner cannot be ascertained, does your program identify and verify individuals entitled to exercise 25%+ voting rights (including veto power) OR who hold senior managing official positions?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you identify and verify these individuals for companies/partnerships

controls.label: For trusts (not verified under simplified procedures) where the beneficial owner cannot be ascertained, does your program identify and verify individuals who hold the power to appoint or remove trustees?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you identify and verify individuals with trustee appointment/removal power

controls.label: For associations or registered co-operatives where the beneficial owner cannot be ascertained, does your program identify and verify individuals entitled to 25%+ voting rights (including veto), entitled to 25%+ property on dissolution, OR who hold senior managing official positions?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you identify and verify these individuals for associations/co-operatives

groups.title: General Beneficial Ownership Obligation
groups.description: Top-level obligation to determine beneficial owners and collect/verify their information before or as soon as practicable after providing a designated service.

groups.title: Exemptions and Simplifications
groups.description: Circumstances where beneficial ownership collection requirements may be modified or exempted.

groups.title: Collection of Beneficial Owner Information
groups.description: Minimum required information to collect about each beneficial owner, and risk-based decisions on additional collection.

groups.title: Verification of Beneficial Owner Information
groups.description: How to verify collected beneficial owner information using reliable and independent sources.

groups.title: Safe Harbour Procedures (Medium or Lower Risk)
groups.description: Optional safe harbour verification procedures for beneficial owners assessed as medium or lower ML/TF risk. Not applicable if any beneficial owner is a foreign PEP.

groups.title: Responding to Verification Discrepancies
groups.description: Risk-based systems to respond when verification of beneficial owner information reveals discrepancies.

groups.title: Unable to Determine Beneficial Owner
groups.description: Fallback procedures when beneficial owner cannot be ascertained—identify and verify individuals meeting specified thresholds or holding key positions.
